oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: US Model 1903 bayonet
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The blade is engraved with "RIA 1908" and the ordnance department insignia on one side and the serial number 119909 on the reverse. RIA stands for Rock Island Arsenal, one of the largest arsenals in the United States and located in Illinois. 1908 was the year of manufacture. This bayonet belonged to James McFerren Johnston, HQ Co., Ord. Corps, attached to the 114th MG Battn., 30th Div. The 30th Div. consisted of National Guard units from Tennessee and the Carolinas and nicknamed "Old Hickory."
